page.title: 09Food in Ythanwells
page.content:
We did a survey to find out how many people in the district still eat the traditional Scottish foods.The most popular Scottish foods eaten are broth and stovies*.Many people still bake bannocks and scones, but only three women in the district bake their own oatcakes,a food eaten daily and called "breid" locally.Most of the people buy their milk, butter and cheese,even though several do milk a cow and make cheese and butter.Girdle scones are quite popular in the district. Potatoes are part of the daily diet of the Ythanwells people.
*Stovies are made from potatoes, onions, fat and leftover pieces of meat and gravy.
